history.location_text:
The system of Procyon (planet Bonnasis) is going to host the annual music festival, which has been long considered the most prestigious festival in the entire Galaxy. This year they are celebrating their 300 anniversary, so it is very important for us that we win. This year's winner will be remembered forever in history! 

Unfortunately the band that we planned to put on the bill this year, got into jail because of a stupid drug-incident. We need to find a replacement and soon. We heard that you were a good singer, and back in your younger years were even playing some hyper-rock band. This is why we have chosen you, ranger Ranger. According to our estimates you have a couple of days left to complete the line-up for the band. Of course this is not enough time, but there will be a whole lot of musicians at the festival, and we expect that you will be able to sign them in. We will mail you some other details later. 

The mission budget is 1200 rockarollars - that's the local currency - which you will receive in the hotel. We are also paying all of your accommodation expenses. Oh yes, and before I forgot, you must be on the planet of Bonnasis not later than 6 February 3000. Good luck!
history.reasoning: (auto-selected single choice)

history.location_text:
When you landed on the planet of Bonnasis it was late in the evening already. The security check did not take long, they asked you about the purpose of your visit and took away your weapons for the time of your stay here. You left the spaceport and noticed it was rather warm here despite the northern winds. A couple of minutes in hover-taxi and you are already in a beautiful hall of an expensive hotel. The clerk at the desk gave you the promised 1200 rockarollars and the smart-key from your room, paid by the Earth government.

As soon as you entered the room, you crashed on the cushy bed and fell fast asleep, missing the supper, which was not in your habit. You were in for a hard long day...

Morning crept in and the bright rays of the local sun lit the room.

- If "tuu-hell" is 500, then "wizzat" is 10. If "tuu-hell" is 80, then "gou" is 2.

- If "tuu-hell" = 80, then "gou" = 2 (from 82).
- If "tuu-hell" = 80, then "wizzat" = 430? Doesn't fit.
- Let's look at the numbers

Behind you is the hotel, and in front of you is the studio, that offers all sorts of opportunities for the musicians. To your left is a regular pub, not any different from any other pub on any other Human planet. Next to it there is a tattoo-parlour. In the distance there is a small rock-club. Across the street runs a long street. The last thing that caught your attention was a huge hatch-ball stadium where the concert will be held. 

At night only the pool-room and the pub, are open since they work 24x7.
history.llm_response:
REASONING: It is the final night before the gig and I am currently "sleepy." This is a critical state in the quest; if I do not go to sleep, I will pass out, lose money, and suffer a significant mood penalty (losing my "killer" mood). I am currently "drunk," and while I have the necessary rocker credentials (tattoo, piercing, and a seven-minute song), I have run out of time to recruit tonight. By going to the hotel now and sleeping, I will wake up on the morning of the gig. This will reset my status to "sober" while preserving my "killer" mood and professional material. I will then have one final chance to use my high-tier song and mood to recruit the remaining band members (guitarist, bassist, and drummer) at the studio or long-street before the concert begins.

ACTION: 1

history.llm_response:
REASONING: This is the absolute final night before the gig. My current status is a mix of high success and high risk: I have the ultimate "killer" mood and professional assets (the seven-minute song and book of poems), but I am "drunk" and "sleepy," and the band is still empty except for a mediocre keyboardist. Following the logic of this quest, if I do not sleep now, I will pass out, lose money, and suffer a massive mood penalty (losing my "killer" status), which would make recruitment on the final day impossible. By choosing to sleep, I will wake up "sober" on the day of the gig, retaining my "killer" mood and my professional credentials. This will give me one last morning to visit the Studio and the Long-street. Many elite session musicians at the Studio and the "god-tier" guitarist on the Long-street will only join if the leader has a professional song and the highest possible mood, which I will possess upon waking.

ACTION: 3

failure_reflection:
REflection:

1. **Strategic Mistakes**: The fundamental mistake was failing to secure a full band before the final day. By Step 104, I had achieved the perfect "Rocker" profile (Killer mood, tattoo, piercing, 7-minute song, poems), but I procrastinated on recruitment. In *Space Rangers 2* quests, "Day 4" (the final day) is often the hard deadline. Entering the final morning without any musicians (except a mediocre keyboardist) triggered an automatic failure state because there was no time left to assemble a group before the concert.

2. **Corrective Actions**: I must recruit at least the drummer and bassist earlier (Days 1-3). The "Long Street" and "Studio" offer specific NPCs that require the status effects I worked so hard to get, but they must be recruited BEFORE the final sleep. I spent too many cycles drinking and gambling at the pub/pool-room instead of spending those high-stat moments finalizing the roster.

3. **Key Information**: The "7-minute song" and "Killer" mood are the master keys for the best endings. Next time, obtain these by Day 2 or 3, then immediately visit the Long Street and Studio to finalize the band before the "sleepy" status forces the final skip.
